tr.td:
An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT

a.title: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as 'ask at order entry questions (AOEs).' This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.

a.title: A Sex Parameter for Clinical Use is a parameter that provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc.. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population

tr.td:
A Sex Parameter for Clinical Use is a parameter that provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc.. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 sex-parameter-for-clinical-use

span.title: EHDS refined base model for This type is for containing or referencing attachments - additional data content defined in other formats. The most common use of this type is to include images or reports in some report format such as PDF. However, it can be used for any data that has a MIME type.

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: EHDS refined base model for Laboratory result report

short.value: Laboratory report model

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for Laboratory result report

short.value: Laboratory Report header

definition.value: Common header for all patient-related data
Patient/subject information

short.value: Document ID

definition.value: Unique identifier of the document
Resource authoring details
Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

short.value: Date and time of authoring/issuing

definition.value: Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

short.value: Date and time of the last update to the resource

definition.value: Date and time of the last update to the document/information

short.value: Status of the resource

definition.value: Status of the resource

short.value: Reason for the current status of the resource.

definition.value: Reason for the current status of the resource.
Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
Business version of the resource.

short.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

definition.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

short.value: Document type

definition.value: Identifies the type of document at hand, e.g. Discharge report.

short.value: Document title

definition.value: Document title, such as Discharge Report, Laboratory Result Report, etc.

short.value: Document status

definition.value: The status of the Discharge report. E.g., preliminary, final.
Time of service that is being documented
Document attestation details
Attester who validated the document. Mulitple attesters could be provided.
Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester.

short.value: Legal authentication

definition.value: Document legal authentication

short.value: Legal authenticator

definition.value: The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document
Date and time when the document was authorized.

short.value: Event type

definition.value: Categorization of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement betwen data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purpuses.
Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

short.value: Document custodian

definition.value: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.

short.value: Document format

definition.value: An identifier of the document constraints, encoding, structure, and template that the document conforms to beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.
Level of confidentiality of the document. Implicit value is normal.

short.value: Related documents and information sources

definition.value: Related documents and information sources

short.value: Health insurance and payment information

definition.value: Health insurance and payment information

short.value: Intended recipient

definition.value: Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable

short.value: Laboratory Report structured body

definition.value: Laboratory Report structured body

short.value: Order Information (Laboratory Result Report could respond to multiple test orders)

definition.value: Order Information (Laboratory Result Report could respond to multiple test orders)

short.value: An identifier of the laboratory test order. Laboratory Result Report may respond to multiple orders.

definition.value: An identifier of the laboratory test order. Laboratory Result Report may respond to multiple orders.

short.value: Date and time of the order placement.

definition.value: Date and time of the order placement.

short.value: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.

definition.value: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.

short.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in textual form.

definition.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in textual form.

short.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.

definition.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded form.

short.value: Specification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the laboratory investigation.

definition.value: Specification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the laboratory investigation.

short.value: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as 'ask at order entry questions (AOEs).' This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.

definition.value: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as 'ask at order entry questions (AOEs).' This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.

short.value: Clinical findings and other observations.

definition.value: Clinical findings and other observations.

short.value: Condition that may influence the service or result interpretation.

definition.value: Condition that may influence the service or result interpretation.

short.value: Medication administered before ordering the service.

definition.value: Medication administered before ordering the service.

short.value: A Sex Parameter for Clinical Use is a parameter that provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc.. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population

definition.value: A Sex Parameter for Clinical Use is a parameter that provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc.. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population

short.value: Vaccination history of the patient.

short.value: Narrative Comments, such as a textual interpretation or advice accompanying the result report, for example.
